name: AudioQuest Forest Active HDMI Cable - 24.60 ft. (7.5m)

overviewFields.title: Solid 0.5% Silver Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. Solid silver-plated conductors are excellent for very high-frequency applications, like HDMI audio and video. These signals, being such a high frequency, travel almost exclusively on the surface of the conductor. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality HDMI cables.

overviewFields.title: Hard-Cell Foam Insulation
overviewFields.value: Hard-Cell Foam (HCF) Insulation ensures critical signal-pair geometry. Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy. Some of this energy is stored and then released as distortion. Hard-Cell Foam Insulation is similar to the Foamed-PE used in our more affordable Bridges & Falls cables, and is nitrogen-injected to create air pockets. Because nitrogen (like air) does not absorb energy and therefore does not release any energy from or into the conductor, distortion is reduced. In addition, the stiffness of the material allows the cable's conductors to maintain a stable relationship along the cable's full length, producing a stable impedance character and further minimizing distortion.

overviewFields.title: Ethernet and Audio Return Channel Enabled – High Speed Data Capacity
overviewFields.value: HDMI standards and capabilities have improved significantly since DVI first evolved into HDMI. All generations are backward compatible. However, not all previous HDMI cables can transmit the full 18Gbps of data required to optimize today’s HDMI 2.0 equipment. While there is currently no 4K/60 4:4:4 software requiring the full 18Gbps capability of HDMI, some sources (UHD Blu-ray players) can be set to “up-sample”, requiring 18Gbps capability. Up-sampling often should be done in the TV rather than in a previous component — but that’s your decision. AudioQuest HDMI cables with "Exceeds 18 G bps" on the box front are guaranteed to exceed the requirements for all possible HDMI data streams.

overviewFields.title: Directionality
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. Arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality.

overviewFields.title: HDMI Active
overviewFields.value: AudioQuest Pearl, Forest and Cinnamon HDMI make use of Active Frequency-Equalization to enable full 18Gbps/4K UltraHD performance from 10 to 15 meters.

name: AudioQuest Photon 48 4K-8K 48Gbps Ultra High Speed HDMI Cable for Xbox - 16.4 ft. (5m)

overviewFields.title: 4K Gaming Up to 144Hz
overviewFields.value: Sports, action movies, high-performance gaming, and VR benefit significantly from the clarity and focus afforded by 4K.

overviewFields.title: 120FPS Gaming
overviewFields.value: Ensures smooth, lag-free, uninterrupted viewing and interactivity.

overviewFields.title: 8K HDR
overviewFields.value: 8K delivers a super-immersive viewing experience with twice the horizontal and vertical resolution of 4K, and four times as many pixels. Combined with the 60Hz refresh rate, this enables smooth, clear viewing of the high-speed action content often found in video games.

overviewFields.title: Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) for Smooth Gaming
overviewFields.value: VRR reduces or eliminates lag, judder, and frame tearing for more fluid and better detailed gameplay. Additionally, VRR enables a gaming source (such as a console or computer) to deliver video frames as fast as it can.

overviewFields.title: 48Gbps Bandwidth
overviewFields.value: AudioQuest "48" HDMI cables can transfer up to professional 10K Ultra-HD video. The 48Gbps bandwidth is made possible by 4 balanced audio/video pairs capable of 12Gbps each. The precision and tighter manufacturing tolerances required to produce HDMI cables that transfer up to 48Gbps bandwidth mean many of AudioQuest’s tried-and-true ingredients and techniques are more important than ever before.

overviewFields.title: 8K/10K
overviewFields.value: AudioQuest 48Gbps HDMI cables have the bandwidth required for video with resolutions up to 10K and resolutions/refresh rates up to 8K/60 and 4K/120. All AudioQuest HDMI cables are completely backward compatible with existing 4K displays.

overviewFields.title: Long-Grain Copper Conductors (HDMI)
overviewFields.value: In AudioQuest HDMI cables, Solid Long-Grain Copper, Silver-Plated Copper, or Perfect-Surface Silver conductors improve Noise-Dissipation and overall performance. Pearl 48 uses Long-Grain Copper for its conductors.

overviewFields.title: Level 1 Noise-Dissipation (HDMI): Direction-Controlled
overviewFields.value: This is the foundation of AudioQuest’s Noise-Dissipation technologies. Traditional "100% shielding" is not enough to guard against the increasingly prevalent effects of Wi-Fi, cellular, and satellite radiation. In AudioQuest HDMI cables, all 19 conductors are Direction-Controlled to minimize the RF Noise that damages performance by "directing" or draining it away from the most vulnerable circuits. Additional Noise-Dissipation techniques (Levels 2 and up) are applied as budget permits to further reduce noise.

overviewFields.title: eARC: LGC + Level-1 Noise-Dissipation
overviewFields.value: Because sound matters, the eARC conductors in AudioQuest's 48-Series HDMI cables receive equal love and affection, featuring the same superior metals, Direction-Controlled Conductors, and Noise-Dissipation technologies as the main AV data pairs. In AudioQuest eARC-Priority cables, the main A/V data pairs have Cinnamon-level performance (Forest 48’s solid 0.5% Silver + Carbon & Vodka 48’s Level-3 Noise-Dissipation), while the eARC data pair and Ground-Reference drain use all the same advanced design ingredients as their “48” counterparts. HDMI’s Audio Return Channel (ARC) sends audio from a TV to a soundbar or AV receiver for greater simplicity and flexibility in system setup. Hardware’s previous ARC capabilities max out at lossy (compressed) 5.1-channel surround sound. Today’s HDMI 2.1 hardware supports enhanced Audio Return Channel (eARC), which increases the digital bandwidth dramatically to support uncompressed and lossless high-resolution multichannel audio, including Dolby TrueHD and Atmos, and DTS-HD Master Audio and DTS: X.

overviewFields.title: Advanced Tapered Boron Cantilever & Reduced Weight
overviewFields.value: The AT33Sa uses a tapered boron cantilever. Tapering the cantilever and revising the number of coil rotations reduce the weight, giving the cartridge better high range performance and wide range reproduction.

overviewFields.title: Neodymium Magnet & Permendur Yoke
overviewFields.value: The model uses a neodymium magnet with maximum energy product BHmax of 50 [kJ/m3] and a permendur yoke with high saturation flux density and outstanding magnetic properties, which further enhances the concentrated magnetic field of the coil gap.

overviewFields.title: Neodymium Magnet
overviewFields.value: The neodymium magnet provides maximum energy (BHmax of 50[kJ/m3]), while the pure iron yoke provides excellent magnetic properties. Together, they further boast the magnetic field concentrated in the coil gap area.

overviewFields.title: PCOCC Coil
overviewFields.value: The PCOCC coil enables purer transmission because it is not subject to grain boundaries in the direction of transmission. *PCOCC = Pure Copper by Ohno Continuous Casting process (Monocrystalline high-purity oxygen- free copper).

overviewFields.title: High-Separation, Wide Response Dual Moving Coil
overviewFields.value: The basic structure is an original MC type, with separate cylindrical coils to the left and right channels. Since power is generated independently in each of the left and right channels, this structure offers truly superior separation. If the signal from the opposite channel escapes, this can cause intermodulation distortion and have a decisive impact on audio quality and how the stereo sound spreads. The structure of this product ensures a clear and smooth sound. Additionally, the two coils have a reverse-V shape which reduces effective moving mass as seen from the stylus tip, limiting unnecessary movement of the coil and further eliminating distortion.

overviewFields.title: VC Mold Limits Unnecessary Vibration
overviewFields.value: The VC mold that affixes the coils is made with hard synthetic resin containing potassium titanate to make it highly strong and rigid. This improvement results in a lighter product, which reduces unnecessary vibration.

overviewFields.title: A Tough Body Designed to Be Rigid
overviewFields.value: The product’s housing is made of precision-cast hard aluminum alloy. Hard synthetic resin sandwiching in the structure on the top and bottom suppresses parasitic resonance. This minimizes unnecessary noise while enhancing rigidity and the signal-to-ratio.

overviewFields.value: AT33SA

name: Ortofon 2M Black LVB 250 MM Phono Cartridge

overviewFields.title: Beyond Amazing
overviewFields.value: The 2M Black LVB 250 upgrades the great build of the 2M Black with a boron cantilever and Ortofon's very own Nano Tube suspension system. The result is a sound so precise and so detailed that you feel like you have let the artist into your house and have them playing right in your living room.

overviewFields.title: Accuracy Level
overviewFields.value: The 2M Black is an amazing cartridge and, by many, considered the ultimate in moving magnet. So, why would we attempt to create something even better? Because perfection runs in Ortofon's blood. The 2M Black LVB 250 upgrades the great build of the 2M Black, and the result is a sound so precise and so detailed that you feel like you have let the artist into your house and have them playing right in your living room.

overviewFields.title: Stylus
overviewFields.value: The 2M Black LVB 250 upgrades the great build of the 2M Black with a Nude Shibata diamond on a boron cantilever. The use of an extremely stiff and lightweight Boron cantilever adds remarkable transparency, speed, and responsiveness. The Nude Shibata stylus’ slim, highly polished profile allows an exceedingly wide contact area to the groove walls and ensures notably detailed reproduction throughout the spectrum, including even the highest frequencies.

overviewFields.title: Multi Wall Carbon Nano Tubes (MWCNT)
overviewFields.value: To attain an optimal interaction between compliance and damping, a new rubber compound for the suspension system has been developed. The new rubber compound formula is based on the Multi Wall Carbon Nano Tubes' (MWCNT) highly efficient nano filler. The new MWCNT-based compound offers desirable mechanical properties, which ensure better damping and improve the overall performance of the cartridge.

overviewFields.title: Compatibility
overviewFields.value: The 2M Series is designed for easy cartridge mounting, weight, and size to fit the most common turntables today.

overviewFields.title: Model
overviewFields.value: 2MBLACKLVB250

name: Ortofon Concorde Music Blue MM Phono Cartridge

overviewFields.title: Premium Moving Magnet Cartridge
overviewFields.value: Experience unveiled and clear sound reproduction with the Concorde Music Blue, featuring a Nude Elliptical stylus on an Aluminum cantilever, and offers an upgrade from the Concorde Music Red. Enjoy seamless upgrades throughout the series, from the Concorde Music Blue to the Concorde Music Black LVB 250, simply by replacing the stylus.

overviewFields.title: Iconic Design
overviewFields.value: Building upon a rich legacy which began when we launched the original Concorde, the Concorde Music holds a storied history as one of the most famous cartridges in the world of audio. Originally developed as a solution to the challenge of easy mounting on a tonearm without screws or wires, the Concorde's unique design earned the Danish Industrial Design Award and became an icon in the audio industry.

overviewFields.title: Stylus
overviewFields.value: The Concorde Music Blue, featuring a Nude Elliptical stylus on an Aluminum cantilever, offers an upgrade from the Concorde Music Red. Nude diamonds, weighing less than their tipped counterparts, enhance responsiveness, detail, and reduce distortion. Enjoy seamless upgrades throughout the series, from the Concorde Music Blue to the Concorde Music Black LVB 250, simply by replacing the stylus.

overviewFields.title: Rubber Suspension
overviewFields.value: A crucially important and vital part of a phono cartridge overall performance is the stylus rubber suspension. Exclusive Ortofon rubber compounds are used for the stylus suspensions in the Concorde Music Blue, carefully produced at the inhouse rubber production, and developed by the research and engineering team at Ortofon for brilliant performance.

overviewFields.title: Coil System
overviewFields.value: The Concorde Music features Ortofon's quad-coil generating system with four split pole pins. Silver-plated oxygen-free copper is chosen for the quad-coil system, along with four Ortofon split pole pins. This results in exceptional channel balance and separation, delivering precise and dynamic sound. With a 6 mV output, it offers lifelike sound with exceptional clarity and fidelity, capturing every detail.

overviewFields.title: Compatibility
overviewFields.value: Installing the Concorde Music cartridge on your turntable is easy and straightforward; no tools are required, making it hassle-free and convenient for all users. This is thanks to the bayonet connector, which makes it compatible with all S-shaped tonearms.

overviewFields.title: Upgradeability
overviewFields.value: The Concorde Music Blue can be replaced or upgraded with all Concorde Music styli, enabling an upgrade path throughout the entire series up to the Concorde Music Black LVB 250. Upgrading the stylus is a simple task; simply pull the stylus off and replace it with the new one. Remember to keep the stylus guard on when installing the new stylus to keep the needle safe.

overviewFields.title: Evolution of a Classic Design
overviewFields.value: Sumiko's Blue Point No. 2 has been a staple among listeners desiring moving coil performance with the convenience of a moving magnet setup. With the Blue Point No. 3 High, Sumiko has reimagined the cartridge housing to improve resonance characteristics, resulting in a sound reminiscent of vintage Shure and Stanton moving magnet cartridges, known for their smoothness and musicality.

overviewFields.title: Enhanced Sonic Performance
overviewFields.value: The Blue Point No. 3 High delivers a rich and inviting low-end response, appealing to bass enthusiasts with its full, warm, yet defined sound. The midrange maintains clarity and lushness, while the high frequencies offer sweet and airy attack and decay, providing a balanced and engaging listening experience across all genres.

overviewFields.title: Versatility and Value
overviewFields.value: In addition to the high-output version, Sumiko offers the Blue Point No. 3 in a low-output variant, catering to owners of moving coil phonostages who seek deeper imaging and enhanced depth. Both versions continue Sumiko's tradition of delivering high-value performance, ensuring there's a Blue Point cartridge suitable for every audiophile's setup.

overviewFields.title: Handcrafted Precision
overviewFields.value: Each Sumiko phono cartridge is meticulously handcrafted in Yokohama, Japan, near the waters where their namesake oysters dwell. Sumiko selects the finest materials by ear, ensuring each design delivers performance that has enlightened generations of listeners. The production process is executed by world-class cartridge makers with a collective eye for precision and quality, resulting in a range of cartridges ready to enhance your analog system.

All styli are physically interchangeable and all cartridge bodies are identical except for Amethyst, which uses an improved anatomy to bolster the performance of the line-contact diamond. Long & short, you have 2 cartridge bodies & 6 replacement styli to choose from, enabling you to shape sonics to suit your preferences!

overviewFields.title: Zero-Tech (No Characteristic Impedance) For Linear, Wide-Bandwidth Noise-Dissipation
overviewFields.value: The only way to avoid characteristic-impedance mismatch-effects between a cable and its attached source and load circuits is to prevent the cable from having a characteristic-impedance. ZERO-Tech succeeds by eliminating the electrostatic field between the cable’s high and low signal conductors, enabling linear (consistent octave to octave) Radio-Frequency (RF) Noise-Dissipation, and uncompressed transients. In order to preserve ZERO-Tech’s complete isolation between signal conductors, a Dual-72v DBS pack is included for Pegasus, ThunderBird, FireBird, and Dragon XLR cables.

overviewFields.title: Solid Perfect-Surface Copper+ (PSC+) Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors prevent electrical and magnetic strand-interaction. PSC+ Solid-Copper minimizes distortion caused by grain boundaries and maximizes linear RF Noise-Dissipation.

overviewFields.title: Foamed-Polyethylene Insulation
overviewFields.value: Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy. Some of this energy is stored and then released as distortion. Because air absorbs next to no energy and Polyethylene is low-loss and has a benign distortion profile, Foamed-PE, with its high air content, causes much less of the out-of-focus effect common to other materials.

overviewFields.title: Level 6 Noise-Dissipation (Interconnects): Zero-Tech + Carbon/Graphene Mesh-Network + Direction-Controlled
overviewFields.value: Radio-Frequency Noise from cellular, WiFi, and satellites is everywhere. AQ’s Level 6 Linear Noise-Dissipation includes a carbon & graphene resistive mesh-network, direction-controlled conductors, and Silver-Plated drain wires, significantly minimizing RF Noise masking effects.

overviewFields.title: Copper-Plated RF-Draining Barrels
overviewFields.value: Grounded Copper-Plated Barrels maximize Noise-Dissipation by preventing a metal barrel from capacitively coupling RF to the conductors.

overviewFields.title: Hanging-Silver Over Red-Copper Plugs
overviewFields.value: AudioQuest’s finest plugs feature superior Hanging-Silver (not tumbled) directly over extreme-purity Red Copper to ensure uncompromised signal transfer.

overviewFields.title: Solid Long-Grain Copper (LGC) Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid Long-Grain Copper (LGC) allows a smoother and clearer sound than cables using regular OFHC (Oxygen-Free High-Conductivity) copper. Solid conductors prevent strand interaction, a major source of distortion. The surface quality is critical because a conductor can be considered as a rail-guide for both the electric fields within a conductor, and for the magnetic fields outside the conductor. LGC has fewer oxides within the conducting material, less impurities, less grain boundaries, and definitively better performance.

overviewFields.title: Direction-Controlled Conductors
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. When applicable, arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality. For most models of AQ cable, the arrows not only indicate the direction that optimizes metal-directionality as part of Noise-Dissipation, but also indicates non-symmetrical attachment of shield and GND in order to optimize full-system performance. A fundamental aspect of AudioQuest's multifaceted Noise-Dissipation technology, Direction-Controlled Conductors ensure induced noise is dissipated and drained properly.

overviewFields.title: Metal-Layer Noise-Dissipation
overviewFields.value: It's easy to accomplish 100% shield coverage. Preventing captured radio-frequency interference (RFI) from modulating the equipment's ground reference requires AQ's Noise-Dissipation. Traditional shield systems typically absorb and then drain noise/RF energy to component ground, modulating and distorting the critical "reference" ground plane, which in turn causes a distortion of the signal. Noise-Dissipation "shields the shield," absorbing and reflecting most of this noise/RF energy before it reaches the layer attached to ground.

overviewFields.title: Hard-Cell Foam Insulation
overviewFields.value: Hard-Cell Foam (HCF) Insulation ensures critical signal-pair geometry. Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy. Some of this energy is stored and then released as distortion. Hard-Cell Foam Insulation is similar to the Foamed-PE used in our more affordable Bridges & Falls cables, and is nitrogen-injected to create air pockets. Because nitrogen (like air) does not absorb energy and therefore does not release any energy from or into the conductor, distortion is reduced. In addition, the stiffness of the material allows the cable's conductors to maintain a stable relationship along the cable's full length, producing a stable impedance character and further minimizing distortion.

overviewFields.title: Double-Balanced Geometry
overviewFields.value: Specifically designed for single-ended applications, Double-Balanced Geometry offers a relatively lower impedance on the ground for a richer and more dynamic experience. While many single-ended cable designs use a single path for both the ground and the shield, Double-Balanced designs separate the two for cleaner, quieter performance.

overviewFields.title: Cold-Welded, Gold-Plated Terminations
overviewFields.value: This plug design allows for a connection devoid of solder, which is a common source of distortion. Instead of solder, the process employs a high-pressure technique. Because the ground shells are stamped instead of machined, the metal used can be chosen for low distortion instead of machinability.

overviewFields.title: Golden Gate
overviewFields.value: Note: All cables in AudioQuest's Bridges & Falls Series place their left and right channels in a single jacket, and feature their Asymmetrical Double-Balanced geometry with separate high-quality positive and negative conductors. This design allows for a thin, flexible, and uniquely versatile high-performance cable that can be terminated with a variety of today’s connections, including 3.5mm (male or female), DIN, and RCA. In Bridges & Falls, you’ll find better metals and more sophisticated technologies — including Air-Tube insulation, Dielectric-Bias System, and Noise-Dissipation System — at lower prices than ever before. Do keep in mind, however, that, by necessity, the plugs on Bridges & Falls cables are fairly close together.

overviewFields.title: Solid Perfect-Surface Copper (PSC) Conductors
overviewFields.value: Perfect-Surface Copper has an astonishingly smooth and pure surface. Proprietary metal-processing technology protects the wire’s surface at every stage of drawing and fabrication. When high-purity low-oxide copper is kept as soft, pure, and smooth as possible, it becomes a wonderfully low-distortion conductor. For over 30 years AudioQuest has pioneered the use of superior metals; yet many were surprised by this huge leap in performance. PSC clearly outperforms previous AQ metals that cost over ten times as much. Electrical and magnetic interaction between strands in a conventional cable is the greatest source of distortion, often causing a somewhat dirty, harsh sound. Solid conductors are fundamental toward achieving Golden Gate’s very clean sound.

name: AudioQuest Mackenzie RCA to RCA Cables - 1.64 ft. (0.5m) - 2-Pack

overviewFields.title: Mackenzie
overviewFields.value: Originally named 'Disappointment' for dashing Alexander Mackenzie’s hope that it would lead to the Pacific rather than the Arctic Ocean, the Mackenzie River is Canada’s largest, longest river system. Traversing 2,635 miles, it flows through a vast network of lakes, boreal forests, and arctic tundra. Mackenzie’s many tributaries cover portions of three provinces—British Columbia, Alberta, and Saskatchewan—and two territories, Yukon and the Northwest Territories. Known as “The Amazon of the North,” Mackenzie’s sparsely populated basin remains one of the great unspoiled natural areas in the world.

overviewFields.title: Solid Perfect-Surface Copper+ (PSC+) Conductors
overviewFields.value: Perfect-Surface Copper+ has an astonishingly smooth and pure surface. Proprietary metal-processing technology protects the wire’s surface at every stage of drawing and fabrication. When high-purity low-oxide copper is kept as soft, pure, and smooth as possible, it becomes a wonderfully low-distortion PSC+ conductor. PSC+ is manufactured by applying the same exceptional technology to an ultra-pure copper. The resulting sound quality is even more focused and simply less in the way. For over 30 years AudioQuest has pioneered the use of superior metals; yet it's surprising by the huge leap in performance made possible with Perfect-Surface Technology. PSC+ simply outperforms all previously available copper metals at any price. All of Mackenzie’s conductors are solid. Electrical and magnetic interaction between strands in a conventional cable is the greatest source of distortion, often causing a somewhat dirty, harsh sound. Solid conductors are fundamental toward achieving Mackenzie’s very clean sound.

overviewFields.title: Nitrogen-Injected Hard-Cell Foam Insulation
overviewFields.value: Nitrogen-Injected Hard-Cell Foam insulation is used exclusively in most of AudioQuest’s video and digital audio cables. Similar to Foamed-PE, it is nitrogen-injected to create air pockets. ‘Hard’ foam is used because the stiffness of the material allows the conductors in the cable to maintain the same relationship with each other along the full length of the cable, thus ensuring that the characteristic impedance of the cable is consistent.

overviewFields.title: Carbon-Based 3-Layer Noise-Dissipation System (NDS)
overviewFields.value: 100% shield coverage is easy. Preventing captured RF Interference from modulating the equipment’s ground reference requires AQ’s Noise-Dissipation System. Metal and Carbon-Loaded synthetics prevent most RFI from reaching the equipment’s ground plane.

overviewFields.title: Triple-Balanced Geometry
overviewFields.value: The three conductors in “Triple-Balanced” Mackenzie cables ensure that whether prepared with RCA or XLR plugs, the positive and negative signals have equally low-distortion conducting paths. The 100% coverage shield is never used as an inferior conductor.

overviewFields.title: Cold-Welded Hanging-Silver Directly Over Pure Purple Copper Plugs
overviewFields.value: This plug design allows for a connection devoid of solder, which is a common source of distortion. Because the ground shells are stamped instead of machined, the metal can be chosen for low distortion instead of machinability. Purple Copper offers a cleaner, clearer sound than the nickel-plated or OFHC metals commonly found in competing manufacturers’ plugs.

name: AudioQuest Carbon USB A to C Cable - 2.46 ft. (0.75m)

overviewFields.title: Solid 5% Silver Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. Solid silver-plated conductors are excellent for very high-frequency applications, like HDMI audio and video. These signals, being such a high frequency, travel almost exclusively on the surface of the conductor. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality HDMI cables.

overviewFields.title: Multi-Layer Carbon-Based Noise- and Crosstalk-Dissipation System
overviewFields.value: This cable's negative conductors are covered with partially conductive Carbon-Loaded Polyethylene. This remarkable material reduces radio-frequency garbage being fed back into the amplifier. The sonic benefit is exactly the same reduction in "hash" and improved dimensionality that comes whenever RF interference is reduced in an audio circuit. In addition, a carbon layer damps interaction between positive and negative conductors, and an external Carbon-Based NDS System reduces external interference.

overviewFields.title: Directionality
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. When applicable, arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality.

overviewFields.title: Solid 1.25% Silver Conductors for Improved Digital Performance
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality HDMI cables.

overviewFields.title: Hard-Cell Foam Insulation
overviewFields.value: Hard-Cell Foam (HCF) Insulation ensures critical signal-pair geometry. Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy. Some of this energy is stored and then released as distortion. Hard-Cell Foam Insulation is similar to the Foamed-PE used in AQ's more affordable Bridges & Falls cables, and is nitrogen-injected to create air pockets. Because nitrogen (like air) does not absorb energy and therefore does not release any energy from or into the conductor, distortion is reduced. In addition, the stiffness of the material allows the cable's conductors to maintain a stable relationship along the cable's full length, producing a stable impedance character and further minimizing distortion.

overviewFields.title: Solid Long-Grain Copper Conductors for Better Performance
overviewFields.value: Unlike standard USB cables, the Pearl USB A-B cable uses solid long-grain copper conductors, which minimize distortion and reduce jitter. This results in a smoother, more natural sound, enhancing the depth and detail in your music.

overviewFields.title: High-Speed Data Transfer with Low Jitter
overviewFields.value: Engineered for precise signal timing, this cable supports high-speed USB 2.0 transmission. The advanced design reduces digital timing errors, preserving the integrity of your audio signal for a more immersive listening experience.

overviewFields.title: Noise-Dissipation System for Clean Signal Delivery
overviewFields.value: The Carbon-Based Noise-Dissipation System absorbs and deflects external interference that can degrade sound quality. By preventing RF noise from polluting the signal, this technology ensures clearer, more dynamic audio playback.

overviewFields.title: Superior Build for Long-Lasting Performance
overviewFields.value: Crafted with precision engineering, the Pearl USB A-B cable features high-quality insulation, shielding, and connectors to provide a durable, reliable connection. Designed to withstand frequent use, it maintains its performance over time.

overviewFields.title: Universal Compatibility for Seamless Connectivity
overviewFields.value: This cable is compatible with all USB Type-A to USB Type-B connections, making it ideal for connecting computers, DACs, music streamers, and other digital audio components. Whether you're a casual listener or an audiophile, this cable is designed to meet your needs.

name: AudioQuest Carbon USB A to C Cable - 2.46 ft. (0.75m)

overviewFields.title: Solid 5% Silver Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. Solid silver-plated conductors are excellent for very high-frequency applications, like HDMI audio and video. These signals, being such a high frequency, travel almost exclusively on the surface of the conductor. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality HDMI cables.

overviewFields.title: Multi-Layer Carbon-Based Noise- and Crosstalk-Dissipation System
overviewFields.value: This cable's negative conductors are covered with partially conductive Carbon-Loaded Polyethylene. This remarkable material reduces radio-frequency garbage being fed back into the amplifier. The sonic benefit is exactly the same reduction in "hash" and improved dimensionality that comes whenever RF interference is reduced in an audio circuit. In addition, a carbon layer damps interaction between positive and negative conductors, and an external Carbon-Based NDS System reduces external interference.

overviewFields.title: Directionality
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. When applicable, arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality.

overviewFields.title: Solid 1.25% Silver Conductors for Improved Digital Performance
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. Solid silver-plated conductors are excellent for very high-frequency applications, like HDMI audio and video. These signals, being such a high frequency, travel almost exclusively on the surface of the conductor. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality HDMI cables.

overviewFields.title: Hard-Cell Foam Insulation
overviewFields.value: Hard-Cell Foam (HCF) Insulation ensures critical signal-pair geometry. Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy. Some of this energy is stored and then released as distortion. Hard-Cell Foam Insulation is similar to the Foamed-PE used in AQ's more affordable Bridges & Falls cables, and is nitrogen-injected to create air pockets. Because nitrogen (like air) does not absorb energy and therefore does not release any energy from or into the conductor, distortion is reduced. In addition, the stiffness of the material allows the cable's conductors to maintain a stable relationship along the cable's full length, producing a stable impedance character and further minimizing distortion.

overviewFields.title: Premium Conductors for Crystal-Clear Transmission

overviewFields.title: Advanced Noise-Dissipation Technology
overviewFields.value: The Diamond USB cable features a unique three-layer carbon-based noise-dissipation system. This multi-layer design effectively blocks most external radio-frequency interference, preventing it from corrupting the signal and maintaining a quiet, interference-free background.

overviewFields.title: Dielectric-Bias System for Dynamic Sound
overviewFields.value: A 72-volt dielectric-bias system (DBS) continuously charges the insulation, minimizing energy storage and improving signal timing. The result? Better dynamics, lower noise, and a sense of space that brings your music to life.

overviewFields.title: Insulation That Preserves Geometry

name: AudioQuest Cinnamon RJ/E Ethernet Cable - 2.46 ft. (.75m)

overviewFields.title: Cinnamon
overviewFields.value: Over the past several years, there’s been a revolution in the way people store, distribute, and access digital media (in real time), including photos, movies, and, of course, music. No longer dependent on physical media, our media is often data that’s moved from multiple devices to multiple locations. For audio applications and protocols, audio over Ethernet offers the virtues of high-speed, low time delay (latency), significant distance capability (328 feet without an active booster or repeater), and extremely low-jitter, bit-perfect communication. Who wouldn’t want all of these things?

overviewFields.title: Solid 1.25% Silver Conductors
overviewFields.value: Solid conductors eliminate strand-interaction distortion and reduce jitter. Solid silver-plated conductors are excellent for very high-frequency applications, like Ethernet audio. These signals, being such a high frequency, travel almost exclusively on the surface of the conductor. As the surface is made of high-purity silver, the performance is very close to that of a solid silver cable, but priced much closer to solid copper cable. This is an incredibly cost effective way of manufacturing very high-quality Ethernet cables.

overviewFields.title: Solid High-Density Polyethylene Insulation
overviewFields.value: Any solid material adjacent to a conductor is actually part of an imperfect circuit. Wire insulation and circuit board materials all absorb energy (loss). Some of this energy is stored and then later released as distortion. Solid High-Density Polyethylene Insulation ensures critical signal-pair geometry while minimizing insulation-induced phase distortion.

overviewFields.title: Terminations
overviewFields.value: Gold-plated nickel connectors with 100% shield coverage.

overviewFields.title: High-Speed Data Capacity
overviewFields.value: The Cat 7 cable standard has been created to allow 10- Gigabit Ethernet over 100 m of copper cabling.

overviewFields.title: Directionality
overviewFields.value: All audio cables are directional. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. Arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality. For best results have the arrow pointing in the direction of the flow of music. For example, NAS to Router, Router to Network Player.

overviewFields.value: RJECIN0.75

overviewFields.title: Superior Audio Performance
overviewFields.value: Featuring solid 1.25% silver conductors, the Cinnamon RJ/E Ethernet Cable minimizes distortion and jitter, resulting in a clearer and more dynamic sound. This design ensures that your digital music retains its intended clarity and depth, providing an immersive listening experience.

overviewFields.title: Reliable and Stable Connections
overviewFields.value: Built to support fast and stable network connections, the Cinnamon RJ/E Ethernet Cable offers outstanding bandwidth capabilities. Its precision-engineered design helps maintain consistent speeds, reducing lag and buffering during critical activities like gaming, streaming, or transferring large files. Experience seamless digital performance that’s both swift and steadfast.

overviewFields.title: Ideal for the Smart Home
overviewFields.value: In today’s connected world, smart devices aren't just conveniences—they’re essentials. The Cinnamon RJ/E makes sure your smart home stays reliable and responsive.

overviewFields.title: Enhance Your Lifestyle Today
overviewFields.value: With the AudioQuest Cinnamon RJ/E Ethernet Cable, you are all set to elevate your digital experience, whether for home entertainment, gaming, or professional use. Make the switch to a high-performance cable that combines quality sound, stable connections, and unbeatable ease of use. Take action now to amplify your digital world.

overviewFields.value: Over the past several years there’s been a revolution in the way people store, distribute, and access digital media (in real time), including photos, movies, and, of course, music. No longer dependent on physical media, our media is often data that’s moved from multiple devices to multiple locations. For audio applications and protocols, audio over Ethernet offers the virtues of high-speed, low time delay (latency), significant distance capability (328 feet without an active booster or repeater), and extremely low-jitter, bit-perfect communication. Who wouldn’t want all of these things?

name: AudioQuest Vodka RJ/E Ethernet Cable (2.5 ft.)

overviewFields.title: Elevate Your Digital Experience
overviewFields.value: In today's interconnected world, the quality of your network infrastructure plays a pivotal role in ensuring seamless digital experiences. Whether you're streaming high-definition content, engaging in online gaming, or managing a smart home ecosystem, the reliability of your Ethernet connection is paramount. The AudioQuest Vodka RJ/E Ethernet Cable is meticulously engineered to meet these demands, offering superior signal integrity and noise reduction for discerning users.

overviewFields.title: Exceptional Conductivity with Solid 10% Silver Conductors
overviewFields.value: At the heart of the Vodka RJ/E Ethernet Cable are its solid 10% silver conductors. This design choice effectively eliminates strand-interaction distortion, a common issue in traditional cables, resulting in clearer and more dynamic sound quality. The use of high-purity silver minimizes impurities and grain boundaries, further enhancing signal clarity.

overviewFields.title: Advanced Noise-Dissipation System for Pristine Signal Transmission
overviewFields.value: To combat radio-frequency interference (RFI) and electromagnetic interference (EMI), the cable incorporates a carbon-based 3-layer Noise-Dissipation System (NDS). This system absorbs and reflects most noise/RF energy before it reaches the ground plane, preserving the integrity of the signal and ensuring an uninterrupted digital experience.

overviewFields.title: Precision Engineering and Robust Build Quality
overviewFields.value: The Vodka RJ/E Ethernet Cable features precision-made Telegärtner connectors with 100% shield coverage and strain relief, ensuring a secure and stable connection. The cable's geometry-stabilizing solid high-density polyethylene insulation maintains critical signal-pair geometry, further reducing distortion and timing errors.

overviewFields.title: High-Speed Data Capacity for Demanding Applications
overviewFields.value: Complying with the Cat 7 cable standard, the Vodka RJ/E supports 10-Gigabit Ethernet over 100 meters of copper cabling. This high-speed data capacity makes it ideal for bandwidth-intensive applications, including high-resolution audio streaming, online gaming, and large data transfers.

overviewFields.title: Durable Design with CMG (CL3 & FT4) Rated PVC Jacket
overviewFields.value: Designed for both performance and durability, the cable's CMG (CL3 & FT4) rated PVC jacket ensures compliance with stringent safety standards, making it suitable for in-wall installations and various environmental conditions.

overviewFields.value: Perfect-Surface Copper+ (PSC+) conductors

overviewFields.value: True-concentric conductors minimize strand interaction and magnetic confusion

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: 72VDC dielectric bias system

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Directionally controlled conductors

overviewFields.title: High-Purity True-Concentric PSC+ Conductors
overviewFields.value: Blizzard uses only AQ's very purest copper: 100% Perfect-Surface Copper+ (PSC+). Both superior metal and conductor geometry greatly reduce ear-fatiguing Transient Intermodulation (TIM) Distortion.

overviewFields.title: Uncompressed High-Current Transfer
overviewFields.value: While many AC power cables feature low DC resistance in order to accommodate the demand for high current, a cable’s characteristic impedance is also crucial for optimal performance. Unlike most AC cables that constrict or compress an audio-provoked transient, AudioQuest AC cables combine low DC resistance and ZERO (no) characteristic impedance in order to deliver uncompressed high-current transients on demand.

overviewFields.title: Ground Noise-Dissipation Technology
overviewFields.value: AC Ground wires provide protection from current-wiring faults, but they also act as antennas. Thus, they are subject to induced radio-frequency (RF) noise. This RF noise bypasses component power supplies and is typically coupled directly into a system’s most sensitive audio/video circuits. AudioQuest’s patented Ground-Noise Dissipation greatly reduces this distortion, yielding unprecedented levels of noise dissipation across the widest bandwidth (range) of radio frequencies possible. AQ's unique circuit-topology utilizes a common-mode phase-cancelling array, in concert with proprietary dielectric materials which provide additional differential linear filtering. (US Patent # 9,373,439)

overviewFields.title: Directionality
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion. The correct direction is determined by listening to every batch of metal conductors used in every AudioQuest audio cable. When applicable, arrows are clearly marked on the connectors to ensure superior sound quality. For most models of AQ cable, the arrows not only indicate the direction that optimizes metal-directionality as part of Noise-Dissipation, but also indicates non-symmetrical attachment of shield and GND in order to optimize full-system performance.

overviewFields.title: Dielectric-Bias System with Black-Level Radio-Frequency Trap (DBS)
overviewFields.value: All insulation is also a dielectric whose electrical properties affect the integrity of the signal. When the insulation is unbiased, dielectric-involvement (absorption and non-linear release of energy back into the signal flow) causes different amounts of time delay (phase shift) for different frequencies and energy levels, which is a significant problem for very time-sensitive multi-octave audio. AudioQuest’s multi-patented DBS creates a strong, stable electrostatic field which saturates and polarizes (organizes) the molecules of the insulation. This minimizes the nonlinear time delays, resulting in clearer sound emerging from a “blacker” background. The inclusion of an RF Trap (a technology developed for AudioQuest’s Niagara Series of power products) in the DBS battery pack further reduces radio-frequency noise. The DBS battery packs will last for many years. A test button and LED allow for the occasional battery check.

name: AudioQuest NRG Hurricane High-Current 20-Amp AC Power Cable - 2 Meters

overviewFields.title: Low-Z/Noise-Dissipation 3-Pole AC Power Cable
overviewFields.value: Alternating Current (AC), is a far-from-perfect power source. AC power technology is well over a century old and was never designed to meet the exacting standards of today’s high resolution audio-video components. AC noise is present at the utility source, and is then exacerbated by radio frequency noise that is induced (picked up by the AC power cord) and coupled to the component power supplies and to circuit ground. This creates distortion and low-level signal losses via the “masking effect.” Further, power amplifiers can require immense reserves of transient current for their power supplies to react to and then stabilize during dynamic audio passages. Most AC power cords and power conditioner-regenerators, though helpful to a point, are simply not up to the task.

overviewFields.title: High-Purity Conductors
overviewFields.value: Hurricane uses solid Perfect-Surface Copper+ (PSC+) conductors to prevent strand interaction, a major source of ear fatiguing transient intermodulation distortion. The astonishingly smooth and pure Perfect-Surface Copper+ eliminates harshness and greatly increases clarity compared to OFHC, OCC, 8N and other premium coppers. The superior purity of PSC+ further minimizes distortion caused by grain boundaries, which exist within any metal conductor.

overviewFields.title: Uncompressed High-Current Transfer
overviewFields.value: With current capacity of 20 amps RMS @ 125VAC 50/60Hz (16 amps RMS @ 220-240VA 50/60Hz), Hurricane/High-Current can withstand current transient peaks many times its continuous (average) RMS rating. This makes Hurricane/High-Current ideally suited for a wide assortment of AC power conditioners, power regenerators, AC isolation transformers, and AC battery back-up devices, as well as any power amplifier, powered subwoofer, powered loudspeaker, powered receiver, or integrated amplifier.

overviewFields.title: Ground Noise-Dissipation Technology
overviewFields.value: AC Ground wires provide protection from current-wiring faults, but they also act as antennas. Thus, they are subject to induced radio frequency (RF) noise. This RF noise bypasses component power supplies and is typically coupled directly into a system’s most sensitive audio-video circuits. AudioQuest’s patented Ground-Noise Dissipation greatly reduces this distortion, yielding unprecedented levels of noise dissipation across the widest bandwidth (range) of radio frequencies possible. Our unique circuit-topology utilizes a common-mode phase-cancelling array, in concert with proprietary dielectric materials which provide additional differential linear filtering.

overviewFields.title: Dielectric-Bias System (DBS; US Pat #7,126,055)
overviewFields.value: By creating a constant dielectric field for the cable’s primary capacitance field or dielectric, DBS assures extended bandwidth and more evenly filtered noise dissipation, eliminating the distortions and ringing that plague other cables even after years of use and so called “run-in time.” In addition, DBS assures that the RF Noise-Dissipation System works as linearly as possible.

overviewFields.title: Controlled for Correct Directionality
overviewFields.value: All drawn metal strands or conductors have a non-symmetrical, and therefore directional, grain structure. AudioQuest controls the resulting RF impedance variation so that noise is drained away from where it will cause distortion.

name: iFi Audio AC iPurifier AC Mains Noise Filter

overviewFields.title: Plug. Play. Believe.
overviewFields.value: iFi’s AC iPurifier is for anyone whose audio is troubled by interference or distortion caused by dirty mains power. It will rid your system of electromagnetic (EMI) or radio-frequency (RFI) interference and brings clean, clear sound to your audio in an instant.

overviewFields.title: Military Grade
overviewFields.value: The AC iPurifier uses iFi’s Active Noise Cancellation technology inspired by military engineering. It ACTIVELY eliminates far more noise across the frequency range than a passive product, even across the lower frequencies.

overviewFields.title: No Harm. No Hum.
overviewFields.value: The AC iPuriifier boasts inbuilt earth/ground and polarity detection. You can always be certain the polarity is correct and that you have the necessary ground/earth connection.

overviewFields.title: Smart Thinking
overviewFields.value: Our Intelligent Ground system ensures the AC iPurifier will not introduce a ground loop when one isn’t needed. Use the 4.4mm grounding socket safe in the knowledge that the AC iPurifier‘s ‘smart’ thinking will keep your system ground loop free. No ground loops mean no annoying hum or buzz. Now, that’s music to our ears.

overviewFields.title: Safe and Sound
overviewFields.value: With in-built surge protection, the AC iPurifier will shut down if it detects a short or a power surge.

overviewFields.title: Many hands may light work…
overviewFields.value: And the same can be said for AC iPurifiers… the more you use, the cleaner the power. You can also add them to your power strip. Why not separate your digital and analogue devices to lessen noise contamination even further?

name: iFi Audio HDMI iSilencer HDMI Noise Filter with Surge Protection

overviewFields.title: High Definition, Minimum Interference
overviewFields.value: SilentPower understands how important it is for you to disconnect and immerse yourself in your favorite media; watching movies or playing games to escape and unwind. However, HDMI connections often carry noise and interference, generated by the circuitry of electronic devices in the signal chain, causing visual artifacts and timing issues that only work to pull you out of the experience. With proprietary noise cancellation and jitter elimination, the HDMI iSilencer restores the true quality of your media, delivering crystal-clear audio and picture-perfect video.

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Active Noise Cancellation II

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Jitter Elimination

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Surge Protection

overviewFields.title: Picture Perfect
overviewFields.value: Inspired by military radar cancellation techniques, our proprietary Active Noise Cancellation technology duplicates incoming noise signals from the source device and inverts the polarity, cancelling out incoming electromagnetic and radio interference. This technology improves depth and dimensionality in both color reproduction and black levels – and means that measured noise drops by 100x (40dB) in comparison to typical noise filters. Coupled with specialized circuitry designed to eliminate jitter, this innovative blend of technology dramatically enhances color depth and black level precision, creating a more immersive viewing experience.

overviewFields.title: Pure Passthrough
overviewFields.value: Despite its active filtration, the HDMI iSilencer lets digital signals pass through perfectly to meet the following video and connection standards:

overviewFields.title: Protect and Preserve
overviewFields.value: The HDMI iSilencer acts as a shield for connected A/V components, featuring a Transient Voltage Suppression (TVS) system to ensure smooth and continuous operation. You’ll never have to worry about surges, lightning strikes, EMI or electrostatic discharges interrupting your movie night or gaming session.

name: iFi Audio iPower X 12V Active Noise Cancelling DC Power Supply

overviewFields.title: Pure silence. Clean power to the maX.
overviewFields.value: With crème de la crème components and tech, the iFi iPower X deep cleans the background noise created in your mains power. Can now be used with a wider variety of equipment.

overviewFields.title: Silence. Personified.
overviewFields.value: The original iFi iPower provides an effective, clean power solution for noise in your system. But why not push your power upgrade to the max with the all-new iFi iPower X? iFi's new ultra-low noise AC/DC power supply has be optimized to take advantage of new knowledge, components and tech in the world of super high-frequency power supply design.

overviewFields.title: Active cancellation
overviewFields.value: The iPower X uses Active Noise Cancellation II  to cancel all incoming EMI or RFI noise. This is the same tech as in active noise-cancelling headphones! Imagine how well these block out cabin noise on a plane compared to regular headphones? This is what the iPower X does to your power supply.

overviewFields.title: Improved capacitance
overviewFields.value: As usual with iFi, every new design means not only improving how it looks on the outside but more importantly, how it functions on the inside. The input capacitance is now 50% larger and the output capacitance is 150% larger when compared to the original iPower. In practical terms, this gives you more filtration, improved dynamics and unsurpassed sound quality.

overviewFields.title: Crème de la crème components
overviewFields.value: iFi is using the latest solid organic capacitors for better suppression of high-frequency noise. And the leakage capacitance is some 20x lower than your normal SMPS! In a nutshell, there is no escape for unwanted noise! All in all, the iPower X will give you 20% more power than the original iFi iPower and increased amperage which means it can work with more equipment than ever before.

overviewFields.title: Sleek, modern design
overviewFields.value: The iPower X comes dressed in a new cream/beige chassis for a cool, clean look. We’ve added several openings and the iFi logo backlit by a pleasant cyan LED light. There’s no second-guessing when this mini work of art is on and connected to the mains. And as always, iFi is giving you freedom. The iPower X is interchangeable with wall pin types across the world (UK/US/EU/AU purchased separately).

overviewFields.title: Because iFi plays music too…
overviewFields.value: Musician? Loving your effect pedals but not so much one when goes down in the middle of a gig? And your spare is nowhere to be found? iFi iPower X has a centre negative adapter so you can use this correctly with your gear. Cleaner sound AND the show goes on! What’s not to like?

overviewFields.title: iPowerX for LED lights
overviewFields.value: Photography? No way. iPowerX can also solve my flickering LED light problem? Yes, a constant current and voltage power supply like iPowerX will ensure that the current supplied to your LED system will remain stable, no matter the fluctuations of the AC power in your wall socket.

name: iFi Audio iPower2 12V Ultra Low Noise DC Power Supply

overviewFields.title: iFi iPower2
overviewFields.value: To quieter and beyond.

overviewFields.title: Come on, heal the noise!
overviewFields.value: Got underlying noise in your system? An irritating noise that you can’t explain? Sonics grainy? It could be as simple as your power supply. Upgrade to the iFi iPower2 to feed your system’s circuits with ultra-quiet, ultra-clean audiophile-grade power.

overviewFields.title: Noise-Cancellation culture.
overviewFields.value: The new iPower2 boasts improved components and a thicker gauge of wiring to deliver improved output/input noise suppression. And with Active Noise Cancellation II to cancel out all incoming EMI and RFI noise, you’ll never feel powerless against noise and graininess again. It is more than 10 times quieter than most audiophile power supplies.

overviewFields.title: iPower2 the people!
overviewFields.value: It comes in 5V, 9V, 12V or 15V. Each voltage is individually available for your particular region and includes a reverse polarity adapter for center pin negative products. Add the iPower2 into your system to bring life back to your music. Discover lost detail today.

overviewFields.title: Plug in, turn on, and chill out.
overviewFields.value: iPower2 comes with a set of 5 five differently-sized adapters to suit some 73% of DC plugs including a reverse polarity (white plug) for professional audio products that require a center-negative feed.

overviewFields.title: Flashdance?
overviewFields.value: If you’re into photography the iPower2 can also solve the annoying issue of flickering LED lights. With a constant current and voltage, the iPower2 will ensure that the power supplied to your LED system will remain stable no matter what fluctuations occur in the AC feed from your wall socket.

overviewFields.title: Dream Team.
overviewFields.value: iFi products are modular. The iPower2 & DC iPurifier2 is like Batman and Robin — a barnstorming combo that enables the customer to try throughout the system to see where they improve the sound the most. It’s official. It’s highly recommended by iFi!

name: iFi Audio iSilencer Max USB-C Noise Filter with Active Noise Cancellation

overviewFields.title: For Silence You Can Hear
overviewFields.value: iFi understands the importance of disconnecting from the daily grind and immersing yourself in music. Whether you're deep in thought on a creative project or finding solace in the soothing tones of your favorite tracks, pristine audio clarity is essential. However, USB-related connection noise and interference can disrupt your listening, disturbing your retreat from the distractions of the world. The iSilencer Max eliminates unwanted USB noise through cutting-edge technology, ensuring your listening experience remains undisturbed and pure.

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Active Noise Cancellation 3 Technology

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Jitter Elimination

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: REBalance® Technology

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Supports up to 20V/5A

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: High-speed USB 3.0 Data Transfer

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Aluminum Housing Enhances Cooling and Durability

overviewFields.title: Silence, Simplified
overviewFields.value: A computer power supply’s USB bus is often sourced from an inadequately filtered switch -mode power supply, that injects noise into connected equipment leading to data errors, loss, and jitter. Simply insert the iSilencer Max between your computer and DAC to effectively cancel out all incoming noise, leaving you with a cleaner, warmer and more transparent sound.

overviewFields.title: Military Precision
overviewFields.value: Inspired by military radar cancellation techniques, our proprietary Active Noise Cancellation 3 technology duplicates incoming noise signals from the USB and inverts the polarity, effectively cancelling out incoming electromagnetic and radio interference. This technology means that measured noise drops by 100x (40dB) in comparison to the common noise filter.

overviewFields.title: Maximum Compatibility
overviewFields.value: The input of the iSilencer Max now supports up to 100W (20V/5A). This greatly expands the list of devices it is compatible with and removes it from the confines of USB DAC Applications.

overviewFields.title: Perfectly Balanced
overviewFields.value: The REBalance technology inside the iSilencer Max rebalances the USB signal to address DC offset and jitter, leading to distortion, and in turn, data packet errors. This technology cleans up the digital signal and ensures the signal received by the DAC is identical to the original source.

overviewFields.title: Speed without Compromise
overviewFields.value: iSilencer Max supports USB 3.0 high-speed data transfer, significantly faster than USB 2.0 standards. This means that it does not impair playback of hi-res audio files, regardless of quality or file size.

overviewFields.title: Interference Immune
overviewFields.value: The aluminum housing of the iSilencer Max is not just for durability. The chassis acts as a heatsink, enhancing cooling performance of the unit. It also ensures complete shielding against Electromagnetic Interference (EMI).

name: McIntosh MPC500 Power Controller

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Advanced Surge Protection

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Secondary Surge Defense for Low Voltage Devices

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Over/Under Voltage Protection

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Customizable Receptacle Control

overviewFields.title: Feature
overviewFields.value: Real-Time Monitoring & Display

overviewFields.title: Comprehensive Surge Protection
overviewFields.value: The MPC500 safeguards your equipment against power line surges, such as those caused by lightning strikes, using a thermally protected metal-oxide varistor (TPMOV) for Line to Neutral protection. This advanced technology is safer than traditional MOVs, providing robust defense for your audio components.

overviewFields.title: Secondary Surge Defense
overviewFields.value: Beyond primary surge protection, the MPC500 shields low voltage devices from secondary surges and spikes that can occur after the initial event. It employs Gas Discharge Tubes (GDT), Positive Temperature Coefficient (PTC) thermistors, and Transient Voltage Suppression (TVS) components to protect your ethernet, coaxial, and other low voltage connections.

overviewFields.title: Voltage Monitoring and Control
overviewFields.value: Equipped with electromagnetic interference (EMI) filtering and over/under voltage protection, the MPC500 monitors your AC line. If voltage levels deviate from safe parameters, it automatically switches off the rear receptacles, preventing your connected devices from operating under harmful conditions.

overviewFields.title: Customizable Power Management
overviewFields.value: The MPC500 features either 8 Type B (NEMA 5-15R) or 4 Type F (CEE 7/3 or "Schuko") receptacles, depending on regional compatibility. You can configure the control of each receptacle to suit your preferences via the rear panel Power Control ports or through the front panel setup menus, offering tailored power management for your system.

overviewFields.title: User-Friendly Interface
overviewFields.value: The front panel display provides real-time information, including input voltage, current draw through the receptacles, and total apparent power. This transparency allows you to monitor your system's power status easily, ensuring optimal performance.

overviewFields.title: Elegant Design
overviewFields.value: True to McIntosh's aesthetic, the MPC500 boasts a black glass front panel, illuminated logo, control knobs, and aluminum end caps. This timeless design complements any audio setup, combining functionality with elegance.

overviewFields.title: Model
overviewFields.value: MPC500
